metadata.title: CVE-2018-5873 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the __ns_get_path function in fs/nsfs.c in theLinux kernel before 4.11. Due to a race condition when accessing files, aUse After Free condition can occur. This also affects all Android releasesfrom CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRDAndroid) before security patch level 2018-07-05.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-lowlatency - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-121.145
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1087-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1087.95
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1090.95
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1055-aws - 4.4.0-1055.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1021-kvm - 4.4.0-1021.26
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-121.145').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.95').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.95').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1055.64').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1021.26').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
